entry.title: Terraform Labs Accuses SEC Of ‘Government Overreach’ In Legal Defense Dispute
entry.summary:
In a recent court filing, bankrupt cryptocurrency firm Terraform Labs has strongly criticized the US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) for its objection to a $166 million retainer paid to law firm Dentons.
The firm argues that the SEC’s objection represents a troubling example of “government overreach” and aims to ” disadvantage ” and distract them just before the upcoming trial.
Terraform Labs Accuses SEC Of ‘Unprincipled Strategy’
In the filing, dated Monday, March 4, Terraform Labs contends that if it hadn’t filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection, the SEC would have no authority or insight into the company’s defense strategy or its decision to allocate funds for legal representation.
However, the company claims that by taking advantage of the bankruptcy process, the …

entry.title: Terra Founder Do Kwon Wins Appeal, Avoids US Extradition For Now
entry.summary:
On Tuesday, March 5, the Appellate Court of Montenegro has overruled the decision of the High Court of Podgorica, which had approved the extradition of Terraform Labs co-founder Do Kwon to the United States for criminal prosecution. The decision, dated March 5, 2024, nullifies the prior approval dated February 20, 2024, and mandates a retrial at the first-degree court, throwing a wrench into the international legal proceedings against the crypto entrepreneur.
Do Kwon Avoids US Extradition For Now: Here’s Why
The Appellate Court’s ruling came after identifying “significant violations of the provisions of criminal procedure” in the initial extradition order. The court highlighted a lack of “clear and valid reasons for decisive facts regarding the order of arrival request letter,” casting…

entry.title: Shiba Inu Lead Dev References .Com Era As SHIB Name Service Update Drops
entry.summary:
As the excitement for the Shib Name service (SNS) heightens, Shiba Inu lead developer, Shytoshi Kusama reveals a new expression standard for the SHIB ecosystem.
Lead Dev Proposes New Standard For SHIB World
In an X (formerly Twitter) post released on Monday, March 4, Kusama proposed the development of a unique standard of expression and identification within the Shiba Inu ecosystem.
Envisioning a decentralized world, where people could express themselves in a new and inventive way, Kusama drew parallels to the lasting impact of the dot-com legacy, a period during the late 1990s to 2000, where investors made large-scale investments into internet-based businesses in the hopes of making profits.
The Shib co-founder has extended his vision beyond conventional norms, urging Shiba In…

entry.title: Official: Bitcoin Reaches New All Time High
entry.summary:
In a momentous surge, Bitcoin has officially smashed through its previous all-time high, surpassing the $69,000 mark. This milestone comes as Bitcoin continues its remarkable ascent after spot Bitcoin Exchange Traded Funds (ETFs) were approved by the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission, leading to a consistent large influx of capital into BTC.
OFFICIAL: #BITCOIN REACHED A NEW ALL TIME HIGH ABOVE $69,000 pic.twitter.com/DccMr0Gnc5 — Bitcoin Magazine (@BitcoinMagazine) March 5, 2024
The Bitcoin market witnessed a flurry of activity as BTC surged to its new peak as BlackRock's spot Bitcoin ETF did over $1 billion in trading volume for the sixth consecutive day yesterday. Bitcoin's previous all time high of $69,010 happened almost three years ago on November 10, 2021, 846 days ag…

entry.title: Let Bitcoin Cook
entry.summary: “Let him cook” has been the expression that all of the young whippersnappers are using lately when describing somebody or something that shouldn’t be interrupted, because they are on a roll. I know this piece will come across as annoying to some, especially because I have only been bullish on bitcoin with some gusto for the last couple of months (though I first pointed it out to my readers in December 2022), but as a newfound member of the church of bitcoin community, I’d be remiss if I didn’t try out my voice a bit. I apologize in advance for opining on things that many members of planet bitcoin have talked about and debated ad nauseam for the last decade. But, one way or another, I have to get myself up to speed, and I do that best cathartically through writing. As a result, you, the rea…

entry.title: Inside The Mind Of a Web3 Gamer

entry.title: How Paris Saint-Germain FC Joined Chiliz as a Validator
entry.summary: Chiliz Chief Strategy Officer Max Rabinovitch joined Decrypt's Stephen Graves at NFT Paris to discuss Paris Saint-Germain FC joining its network as a validator, and how consequential Web3 adoption in sport will come from the grassroots.

entry.title: The Sandbox Co-Founder Sébastien Borget: 'The Future of Gaming is User-Generated Content'

entry.title: 'Calladita' Director Miguel Faus: How Web3 Filmmaking is 'Taking the Castle'
entry.summary: Miguel Faus, director of NFT-funded feature film "Calladita," joined Decrypt's Stephen Graves at NFT Paris to talk about the film's recent premiere and how the "radically independent" decentralized Film3 movement is evolving.

entry.title: Pudgy Penguins Teams Up With Unstoppable Domains

entry.title: Improbable Chief Product Officer: Web3 Games Need to Put Experience, Game Logic Onchain

entry.title: Ledger: 'Probably Five Years' Before Phones With Fully Integrated Hardware Wallets

entry.title: What Is Notcoin? Co-Creator Sasha Plotvinov Explains the Viral Telegram Game and Token
entry.summary: Notcoin, a simple clicker-style game within messaging app Telegram, has racked up over 25 million players since the start of 2024 and plans to convert the trillions of virtual coins mined so far into a real crypto token on The Open Network. Open Builders founder Sasha Plotvinov joins Decrypt's Andrew Hayward to explain the viral phenomenon.

entry.title: 'Pixels' Founder Luke Barwikowski on the Game's Wild Rise and Ronin Move
